page.title: 11Ditchingham Village Hall 2
page.content: had raised Â£18,000 from coffee mor- nings, fetes and donations including those from Ditchingham United Chari- ties. The hall is a Charitable Trust with a management committee of one representative from each group using it. There is a large main hall with stage and changing rooms, a kitchen, committee room, two store rooms and cloakrooms. Regular users include: Mother & Toddler Club, Discussion Group, Playgroup, W.I. Youth Club, 2 to 3 Year Old Club, Infants Clinic, Brownies, Playgroup and Dance Club. It is also used for Indoor Bowls, Wed- ding Receptions, Whist, Bingo and Bad- minton on a regular basis and for con- certs, parties, dances, jumble sales and other fund-raising activities, darts tournaments, horticultural shows and political and parish meetings.
